intro: Dryas × lewinii, commonly known as the mountain avens, is a hybrid evergreen perennial plant native to the alpine and arctic regions of North America. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its dense, low-growing habit and dark green, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Dryas × lewinii is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and resilience in harsh climates.
